contentList.content: A squriming mesh of straps and leathers that seems living to the touch. It conforms perfectly to your body, and you feel as if you are wearing nothing at all.
The armor distracts those next to you, giving you bonus <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">AC</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier against melee attacks.
The armor distracts any that attacks you, giving you bonus <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">AC</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier against attacks.

You are perpetually on edge; the number you need to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> while attacking is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.
Your armor shifts on its own to protect its wearer. You take [1] less damage from all sources.
Your attacks and spells deal additional damage equal to your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.

Excited by combat, your armor comes to life. It subversively stimulates you, and you must make progressively harder Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> to stay on your feet. You receive <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentration</LSTag> checks until you sate it.
Excited by combat, your armor comes to life. It subversively stimulates you, and you must make a DC [1] Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> to stay on your feet.
You fall to the floor, convulsing and unable to control the natural reaction of your body.

Your armor shifts, as if to bring you more comfort. You receive +[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and regenerate [2] HP a turn. Is it sated, or have you merely whet its appetite?
